dialogues.text: I don’t care fe I got the promotion just to hold your hand. I’m gonna prove I deserve it. My wife understands. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: Vega. Trust me. Go home. Britten turns to leave, but Vega doesn’t move. Britten shrugs. As Britten starts to walk-

dialogues.speaker: VEGA
dialogues.text: You were joking right?

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: wat or OPPin9)

dialogues.speaker: VEGA
dialogues.text: About going back to that crime scene because of a dream. That’s not why we went, right? Cause, you know, weird stuff like that, it’s sort of what they told me t6 look out for. OFF Britten’s expression-—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police everywhere, ambulance, reporters. Bird steps next Britten. They see the GIRL with officers.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: She says he kept talking about marrying her. That the Lord had brought them together. (long beat) So, the red hair. The obsession with that parking space. They’re going to ask how you put all that together.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: Right. (a beat) Can we call it a hunch for now? Bird looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: I've been a cop for thirty years. Only seen hunches on TV. But for now... okay, we go with hunch.  58. We see the Girl being led into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: What happens to her?

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: She goes to an aunt or something. I’m not sure she even understands what’s happened yet. As they watch the ambulance doors close behind the girl- BIRD (CONT’D) Remember when you used to think solved and fixed meant the same thing?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DR. LEE’S OFFICE Dr. Lee leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: Detective, turning yourself in circles like this, over and over, it will catch up with Yous This fantasy is far from a benign coping mechanism. When your brain should be resting, recharging, you’re using it to hold up a detailed and complicated alternate reality. A reality that only gets more complicated the longer it exists. That is unsustainable, Detective Britten. I’m afraid that the longer ou continue, the more you jeopardize your already tenuous grasp on reality. It is, quite simply, a road to madness. A long beat as this weighs on Britten. Then-

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: The thing is doctor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britten and HANNAH are in black, surrounded by mourners.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: - yes, I still see both my wife and my son.  59. Hannah leans on him SOBBING as a casket is lowered into t ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britten and REX are in black, surrounded by mourners.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I’ve also watched each of them lowered into the ground. REX WEEPS as the casket descends.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRITTEN’S HOUSE - REX’S ROOM Britten assists Hannah, clearing out the last of Rex’s st She looks at him, leans down, opens a paint can.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: And when yoo see a Vee one being buried, the one thought you have over and over and over again, is that you would give ANYTHING to change it. Suddenly, her ‘move past it’ exterior cracks and she fina begins to CRY. As he pulls her into his arms-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britten sits alone in the stands watching Rex practicing relentlessly with his coach TARA.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So if you're telling me that the price of being able to see them, to eel them, to have them, is my sanity- After crushing a forehand that sends Tara sprawling, Rex looks up at his father, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Britten and Rex have dinner in the bar, watching football highlights on the screen.  60. BRITTEN (V.O. Then let me assure you I will happily pay it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRITTEN’S HOUSE - KITCHEN Britten and Hannah eat. She’s still raw, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’1l come here as long as they make me, but trust me- She puts her hand on his. They look in one another's eyes BRITTEN (V.O.) (CONT’D) I have no desire to ever make progress.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRITTEN’S HOUSE - MARK'S BEDROOM Britten and his wife hay. in bed together, only a sliver light sneaking through the window. A LONG SILENCE. Then -

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Will you see him tonight? Britten looks over at her. He’s not sure what she wants t hear. He simply opts for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: Yes. She takes that in. He prepares | himself for the recriminations. Instea she kisses him on the cheek. Softly-

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Tell him that I love him. As she turns away Britten fights the lump in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTEN
dialogues.text: I will. Britten closes his eyes. We push in very close on his closed eyelids. A long beat. Then- He opens them.
